data.title: IndyGo Employment Opportunities
data.text:
IndyGo Employees Work Together to Move Our City

IndyGo is committed to improving access to opportunity and providing reliable mobility options. Make a difference in your community in ways that directly benefit the people of your city — people who’ll depend on you, people you’ll be proud to serve. Represent the IndyGo system, person-to-person, face-to-face, and launch a rewarding, new career with us. IndyGo employees make a meaningful difference in the lives of those who live, work, and visit Indianapolis. Join our team today, and give people critical access to economic, cultural, health, educational, and recreational opportunities — with safe, reliable, courteous IndyGo service.

Please use Chrome, Edge, Firefox, or Safari when viewing our employment opportunities. Internet Explorer loses some functionality.

IndyGo is now offering a $3,000 signing bonus for new hires who apply to become a bus driver or mechanic! This incentive is in direct response to the ongoing driver shortage and aims to rightsize the agency’s workforce.Learn more here.

VIEW OPEN JOBS

IndyGo has a strong commitment to the community we serve and our employees. As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to have a workforce that reflects the community we serve. No person shall be unlawfully excluded from employment opportunities based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation, and pregnancy), age, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or other protected class. Individuals with questions, comments, or concerns about this policy should contact the IndyGo EEO Officer at eeocomplaints@indygo.net.

Contact Us:

Email: careers@indygo.net

Know Your Rights: Discrimination is Illegal

Join Our Security Team

Ready to make history as a pioneer in a brand-new customer service position in Indianapolis? Do you enjoy working with the public? Are you friendly with a willingness to help solve problems?

NOLAN Security is hiring fare inspectors for IndyGo’s bus rapid transit (BRT) routes. As a customer-focused position, the fare inspector will serve as an ambassador for IndyGo. Inspectors will also uphold IndyGo’s fare policy, deliver excellent customer service and educate riders on IndyGo’s policies and procedures.

NOLAN Security offers paid training, uniforms, flexible work hours and paid vacation. Job advancement opportunities are available with excellent performance.

Learn more about becoming a fare inspector HERE. Apply HERE.

Join Our IndyGo Access Services Team

Come discover a work experience where diverse ideas are met with an environment that offers a challenging, stimulating and rewarding career! Transporting people and providing an essential service on a daily basis is what truly moves us at RATP Dev USA. By joining our team, you will get a bus pass to ride IndyGo, for FREE – as well as great benefits and competitive wages!

Take a look at some of the open positions and apply click HERE.
